title: Lovely food
text: Good solid food here and staff were very pleasant. We were tired after a long journey and the food here was most welcome. A very busy place. Really good scampi here and freshly cooked

title: Unpleasant stay
text:
We stayed here recently and unfortunatley we did not have a nice stay. The proprietor was pleasant on arrivel but after that he was not helpful and was quiet rude at times. The television did not work in the room and he did not come to sort it out when we asked. There were lots of signs on the back of the door about what not to do etc. The were similar signs in the livingroom. There were security cameras on the front door - most unusual in b and b's in Ireland. Breakfast is only served from 8 to 9.30 and again this is unusual in Ireland, especially at weekends. I totally agree with the reviewer who said they felt quite uncomfortable. The Breakfast was not great and there was only preserved fruit not fresh fruit. The eggs were fine, there was butter spread and not real butter. Honey was in a squeezie plastic carton. The room was fine but damp was obviosly a problem around the windows and the sheets were really thin.
They seem to want to just make money and in my opinion give b and b's a bad name

title: Wonderful lunch in this trendy bar
text: I had to meet someone and we picked here as it had great reviews. We were not disappointed. The food was really good and the place is bright and airy. Parking is nearby

title: Home made food in lovely surroundings
text: We stopped in Cashel on route from Kerry and by chance spotted this restaurant. It was a Sunday morning and it was full of locals having breakfast etc. Always a good sign. We had great coffee and marscapone and raspberry cheesecake which was georgous. I would definitely would recommend here. Staff were lovely and it is obvioulsy well supported by locals. Parking outside was easy and the place is very nicely decorated

title: Wonderful experience
text: Besides the wonderful views, Kerry is beautiful anyway, the Boathouse has great food. From the brown bread, which is the best I have ever had to the wonderful fish dishes, this meal is up there with the best. The staff were lovely and needless the say the views are amazing. I will be back when we are next in Kerry

title: Lovely hotel within easy reach of Galway
text: This is a good business hotel. Staff were very friendly and the place is really clean. Bar food is very good and there is plenty of parking. There are trains into Galway on a regular basis. We have used the hotel for business meetings and all our needs were catered for

title: Great hotel
text: We loved this hotel. Rooms were georgous, really speacious and looked onto a lovely pool area. Food was fantastic and the hotel staff were very helpful. Kata Beach resort is lovely and really family friendly. I travelled with a female friend and we did not want any noisy or seedy places. This was perfect as we wanted a quiet place for a rest. Plenty of local restaurants and shops etc. The beach is across the road and the whole area is great

title: Wonderful museum
text: This was interesting and really brought the story of ancient Greece to life. Give yourself time here to really appreciate the items on view

title: Amazing place
text: This was the highlight on a recent trip to Athens. If its wet then bring shoes that dont slip as some of the stones would be dangerous in wet weather. The buildings and history are amazing

title: Beautiful place
text: You enter another world when you visit here. This large estate and hotel bring you back in time to a gracious world

title: A must if you visit Kilkenny
text: This has a wonderful history and is really interesting. Lovely cafe on site as well. There are large gardens as well

title: Lovely hotel and friendly staff
text: This hotel is really clean and well maintained. Good parking. The food in the bar was very good and staff were lovely. The room was perfect. It is a bit of a walk into the centre of Kilkenny but the receptionist told me where to park which was great.

title: Lovely hotel
text: This is a lovely hotel, clean and breakfast is good. Staff were helpful. There is not a lot in the area regarding restaurants. It is approx 10 mins from underground which is easy to use. We used taxis but found that they were all a different price and one taxi had his hand on the meter and kept upping the price. When I objected he did not seem to care

title: Great food
text: We just came across this place when visiting Strandhill. The food is really fresh and reasonably priced. Staff are very nice as well

title: Location Location
text:
This hotel is perfect for visiting Ho Chi Minh City. The hotel itself is clean and the rooms are good with great showers, tea/coffee maker etc. Breakfast was also very good and chef making omelets, fried eggs etc. Great selection.
The location is fantastic as you can walk everywhere. Turn left out of the hotel, then left again and there is a great street market food area. Super food and really cheap. You can walk to nearly everywhere from here. We walked to the Continental Hotel for cocktails on the roof etc. There is a great market just across the road and it is also walking distance to the Saigon market.

title: Well worth a visit
text: This is certainly worth a visit. It is part of the history of Saigon or Ho Chi Minh city, whichever way you look at it. It will help you understand the American War

title: Beautiful
text: You feel you are part of a Somerset Maugham novel when you visit here. You can post letters which is great. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Visit early in morning
text: This is a must if you visit Vietnam. Try to get there as early as possible as it gets busy later. This is very organized and it is amazing how small the tunnels are and also what they were used for originally

title: Must visit
text: You feel you are taking part by visiting this place. It is very well kept and there are great details around about what happened here.

title: Great location
text: Central location in a quiet street. We were able to walk to the waterfront and had dinner in a lovely location. Breakfast was great. This area is great for trips on the Mekong delta. Try and get a room at the back.

title: Very interesting
text: This was part of our trip and it further enhanced our trip and helped us under the beautiful Vietnamese people

title: Well worth visiting
text: Again this was on our itinerary and it was very interesting. The temple is calming and brings you back to reality
place: Meditation Centre Truc Lam Phuong Nam

title: Wonderful food
text: We just happened upon this restaurant whilst walking on the waterfront. It was busy so we decided to see if we could get a table outside, which we did. The food was really good and the local wine was also fine. We had a mixture of food and it was fantastic. We had cocktails as well and these were great.

title: Very interesting
text: This is well worth visiting and it remind me of the Forbidden City. It was also a pleasant interlude during our trip.

title: Beautiful place
text: This is a beautiful place and give yourself a few hours here as it is very interesting. Restoration is ongoing and it is really well done. Lots of interesting information around about previous Emperors

title: Wonderful hotel
text: This was our second visit and it is still wonderful. We had our dog with us and we had a suite overlooking the lake. This had an enclosed balcony which was great for our pooch. The staff here are wonderful as they make you feel so welcoming. Add to that the fantastic food and its perfect. It is also spotless. We stayed two nights but I would have been happy to have stayed longer. We had a friend join for dinner one night for dinner and the ambiance in the dining room is great. We travelled to the Inishowen Peninsula on one of the days and this was a perfect way to spend the day. The beautiful weather added to the break. Overlooking Lough Eske, this hotel has the perfect location. We also spent time in Donegal town and they have beautiful shops which are well worth visiting

title: Extremely interesting
text: If you are Irish or have any Irish connections, this is worth a visit. It has been very well done and it brings all your history lessons to life regarding the Flight of the Earls etc.

title: Great chocolate
text: This place has great chocolate. The coffee is good but the chocolate is fantastic. A real fix when you need it.

title: Beautiful location and worth visiting
text: If you are in the area it is well worth visiting Carton with its beautiful walks. Stop for coffee or lunch and take in all the history of this amazing house
place: Carton House, A Fairmont Managed Hotel

title: Lovely food here
text: Most of the food here is home made. It is busy at weekends as they have lovely cakes, soups etc. Parking is very good.

title: Excellent value for money, great location and clean
text: I stayed here recently and it is so easy to find. - Just head out from one side of the train station and it is only a two minute walk. Very friendly receptionist and our room which was on the 4th floor was large, very clean and had a good shower and bath. Breakfast was fine, plenty of ham, cheese, hard boiled eggs etc. They were very nice in reception and got us a taxi to visit the Borghese gallery. We were able to leave our bags while we walked Rome and the next day we headed to the train staion to journey further. The bus from the airport pulls in at the same side of the train station as the hotel so its location is fantastic. Nothing fancy here but we spent most of our time ambling round Rome as we had already seen the sites. We also found a great local restaurant a few streets behind the hotel and besides great food it was very reasonable.

title: Beautiful fountain
text: It was very busy here eve though it was November Its such a pity that its all built up around. We found a lovely church where we were able to have a quiet moment just facing the fountain

title: Good host, clean room but lacking in some things
text: It was difficult to find this place, it is down a small alleyway. The area is very safe, as is all of Sorrento. Once we found the place it was centrally located. The room did not have bedside lights and there was little place for clothes etc. It was not the most comfortable place but the host was very helpful and it was very clean. Having no breakfast , which we knew in advance, was not great as there was no tea/coffee maker in the room either.

title: Great location for a budget stay. Safe location and easy distance of the attractions.
text: This was perfect for us as we were going to the opera. It is just a short 3 min walk to the opera house on an upmarket shopping street. Across the street is an amazing café/restaurant. We picked up the key from the shop next door. We were brought to our room which was clean, not too big but perfect for us. Basic but good. Breakfast was deliver to the room the next morning, coffee, croissants etc. Perfect for us. There is a lot to see in Naples in hidden alleys etc.

title: Wonderful
text: We recently visited here. It had an amazing visitor experience. This is worth half a day to really experience here. Don't forget to visit the neat nearby the Endeavor. I loved this

title: Expensive
text: The garden is beautiful and the house is very interesting. It was expensive for what we got and the tour was very rushed. We had to leave one room before the next group came in. Villa Carlotta is much more interesting.

title: Wonderful location and great food
text: We stayed here recently as part of an organised trip. We paid extra to get a Lakeview and it was certainly worth it. The rooms were very clean and whilst the hotel is slightly dated it has the atmosphere of a Grand Dame hotel. Wonderful. The food was really good and the choices were fanatic. Staff were lovely and attentive. There is a great roof terrace for drinks and the views are amazing. The location is very good as it is only 3/5 mins walk to the car ferry which will take you across to Bellagio or Varenna where you can use the rain. The possibilities are endless. Next door is Villa Carlotta which is certainly worth a visit. There are la lot of attractions nearby also.

title: WOW - AMAZING FISH AND SEAFOOD
text: We came upon this restaurant by accident as we were staying in the area. We had booked ahead as our hotel said it was very busy. The food was exceptional. Beautifully cooked a full fresh cod, and large prawns in garlic butter were the order of the day. We also had scallops and again they were perfectly cooked. If I return to the area I would definitely be back here. The staff were really nice and most of all the price was very reasonable.

title: Well worth visiting
text: On a recent visit to this area we went to the Hook Lighthouse. This is well worth a visit and it is worth doing the tour. there is a lovely café here as well.

title: AMAXING GARDEN AND DEFINITELY WORTH A VISIT
text: This is garden heaven. 70 acres of garden with some wonderful planting. This is a treasure and should be promoted more by the Government as it was handed over to the State by the last owner. Hedges of blue hydrangeas, magnificent rockeries, walled gardens etc etc. Allow at least 3 hours to get the best and I will definitely be back. There is a lovely café on site and you can also buy plants. The staff were most helpful and this is a labour of love for most of them.

title: Lovely Garden to visit
text: This garden is next to Tintern Abbey. It is beautiful and just the place to wander at any time of year. I noticed that some people would not pay the money to enter and this is such a pity as it is very cheap to enter.

title: Really relaxing hotel
text: On a visit to the Peak District we stayed here. The staff were very friendly and it is in a beautiful location. We had bar food as it was too warm to eat inside and this was lovely. The breakfast was superb and I was surprised as it is difficult to get a good one. There is a real relaxed air about this place and we loved our stay here.

title: Beautiful location and great location for Giants Causeway
text: I stayed here recently during a business trip. The staff were very friendly and I had a great room overlooking the sea. It is near Bushmills and the Causeway. The room was very nicely decorated and spotless. Breakfast was very good.

title: Lovely Hotel in Beautiful location
text:
I stayed here recently on business. Staff were very good and the hotel has been upgraded since I stayed previously.

I had a meal in the bar on arrival and it was lovely. Overall I would highly recommend here. Unfortunately I didn't have time to use the spa.

title: Great Massage in the Spa
text:
I had a massage here last week as they got a new masseur. Normally hotel masseurs are not great as they are beauticians who do a bit of massage.
The masseuse was from Croatia and you would know she is fully trained. She completely eases all my aches and pains and I will definitely be back

title: Lovely food
text: We had a lovely meal here. Service was great and I would definitely return. It is on the Main Street in Maynooth and you can park in the street behind. Lovely atmosphere here so. It would be good for any occasion

title: Pure fresh food . Wonderful to eat here
text: I as here before Christmas and as always the good us great here. I just had coffee and a fruit tart whilst my sister had lunch. I love just looking at all their cakes and buns. The shop us great too . This us so central as it's just at the side of Trinity College and near the National Gallery. A shirt stroll to St Stephens Green which us worth visiting is the day is fine as there are lovely gardens there. Also visit Trinity and see the Book of Kells

title: Lovely restaurant with great Food and a lovely atmosphere
text: I stopped in Roscommon to meet a friend and she suggested here as I don't know the area. I was reAlly impressed as there is a lovely atmosphere. We has great food . I had a perfectly cooked steak and presentation was excellent. Wine was at room temperature and lovely. My friend was really impressed with her pasta dish. Menu is impressive and the desserts were lovely. Service was very good and very professional

title: Real fresh food and great coffee
text: This was my second visit today. This is a lovely restaurant which is spacious and bright. They serve lovely fresh food great salads and the desserts look great even though I keep away from these and the range seems to be increasing. I had a great lunch and food was really fresh and seems to be sourced in Ireland. I love cappuccino and they have great coffee here. It is easy to park here and they seem to gave built a walkway to the train station. They also have an area where they sell Irish handcrafts and I love anywhere that's supports Irish goods.

title: Beautiful campus and lovely to walk around
text: This is a hidden gem in Cork. There are beautiful buildings and the grounds are really well kept. the Honan Chapel is a quiet haven amidst the buzz of of college life

title: Great bear viewing trip
text: My husband and myself were in Homer recently. We flew with them over to Lake Clark NP . We had an amazing flight first of all over the inactive volcano and later we flew way down over lots of bears. We were able to clearly see them jumping or salmon.

title: We loved Homer
text: We visited Homer and it is one of the most beautiful places I have been. Amazing scenery on all sides. It is a quirky sort of town and untouched by the cruise business. Great shops and restaurants. No trip is complete without a visit to the Salty Dawg and also a boat trip

title: Well worth a visit
text: Great explanation of the whole area and staff were very helpful. It shows how the area developed and explained all about whaling and fishing
place: Alaska Islands and Ocean Visitor Center

title: Great food and service. Views awesome
text: We just had dinner there. From the moment we arrived the service was very good. Darrel looked after us and he was really helpful. Food was all cooked individually and really fresh . We both had and it was really good. We had a table overlooking the sea and there was the most amazing sunset ever c such an added bonus. The best we have had so far in Alaska

title: My top attraction in Anchorage
text: We cycled thus beautiful trail. It is very easy as I haven't cycled in a long while. Wonderful amenity

title: Food not great and bad service
text: Food not great. Chips were lukewarm and I felt they were left over. The only veg was broccoli . Burger was ok. Service was indifferent and when we asked for the bill the waiter said he couldn't get as it wasn't his area. We then had. To wait for our waitress to appear as waiter didn't look for her

title: Closely coffee oity about the paper cups and plates
text:
We had lovely coffee here. Cakes are great. It is such a pity that they use paper cups and plates and plastic knives. In a place as beautiful as Anchirage then I would think that people should not use these
paper and plastic items do we can keep our environment clean plus I think it's horrible to drink from paper cups

title: Lovely food pity but pity about the loud televisions
text: I met a friend here fir a catch up. We had lovely bar food and the service was excellent. All was well until the TVs were turned up for some match. As thus was the only area and the mouse was loud we left. I don't understand why the whole bar was used for TVs coverage. Not everyone is interested in sport.

title: Georgous hotel in wonderful setting
text: I recently stayed here and we had a really lovely time. The place is just comfortable and the staff were really friendly. The rooms are all built around a lovely courtyard and ours had a great view of the lake. Rooms were really spacious and beautifully decorated. Staff were really nice and chatty and this place felt more like a country house rather than the formality of a hotel. I would highly recommend here as it is set in a lovely woodland with great walks all around the lake. Cong is a beautiful little village and this whole area is great for sightseeing places like Ballintubber Abbey, Galway and the beautiful West of Ireland.

title: Pleasant conference hotel but breakfast is like school.
text: This place has a few buildings so you may get wet if it's raining. No lifts so I had to haul luggage to 2nd floor. Room was spotless but rooms are small. All facilities like iron hairdryer etc. Breakfast is not good as you can only get tea from a flask and its lukewarm. You feel it's like a school canteen. Fruit is limited and selection is not hood. It lacks the finer touch. There did not appear to be anybody in charge. There is a nice pub The Craddock around the corner and its good for dinner
